alert.note: Alert for Daviess; Gibson; Knox; Pike (Indiana) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued March 05 at 10:15PM EST until March 14 at 4:16PM EST by NWS Indianapolis
info.description: ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in Indiana... White River near Ravenswood and from Spencer to Hazleton. .Minor flooding is ongoing along the Wabash, White, and East Fork White rivers and several tributaries across central and southern Indiana. Moderate flooding continues along the Wabash River near Lafayette. Rainfall of 1.5 to 3 inches fell over the course of Friday March 3rd, which has brought the widespread flooding to the area. Flooding is ongoing along the full length of the Wabash River with the crest near Lafayette. Much of the White River is in flood with river levels rising in points downstream of Spencer. Flooding along the East Fork White river is expected from Seymour to Williams, with the crest near Seymour. Flooding along many smaller tributaries will end by Tuesday with flooding continuing through the week along much of the Wabash, White, and East Fork White rivers. ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL TUESDAY, MARCH 14... * WHAT...Minor flooding is occurring and minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...White River at Petersburg. * WHEN...Until Tuesday, March 14. * IMPACTS...At 21.3 feet, State Road 257 south of Washington began to flood during May 2008 after local rains of more than an inch on very wet soils with Petersburg at 21.3 feet and rising and Shoals at 15.5 feet and rising. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 9:30 PM EST Sunday /8:30 PM CST Sunday/ the stage was 19.2 feet. - Recent Activity...The maximum river stage in the 24 hours ending at 9:30 PM EST Sunday /8:30 PM CST Sunday/ was 19.2 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise to a crest of 22.1 feet early Friday morning. It will then fall below flood stage Tuesday, March 14. - Flood stage is 16.0 feet. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding. Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov/ind. This statement will be updated by noon Monday.
